title: Sidewall - Panel, ca. 1765
medium: Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper
provenance: Removed from the walls of the Samuel Buckingham House, built 1768, in Old Saybrook, Connecticut. Evidence that the paper was hung at the time the house was newly finished.
creditline: Gift of Jones and Erwin, Inc.
description: Pillar and arch design. "Britannia" enthroned amidst Corinthian columns, arches and urns. Corinthian columns support alternatively large and small arches. An urn on a pedestal beneath each of the smaller arches. Under larger arches: concave colonnade of Doric columns, topped by a statue of Britannia, facing left, holding spear, resting on shield, printed in black and white on gray ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sidewall - Panel, ca. 1765.
ca. 1765. Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper. Gift of Jones and Erwin, Inc.. 1970-26-2.
